author: Rachael Krause, Antonia Velez
title: Encuesta revela preocupaciones sobre acceso al aborto | 9news.com
text:
DENVER — Una nueva encuesta demuestra que muchas mujeres están preocupadas por la falta de acceso al aborto.
>>> Read in English
"Las personas están preocupadas sobre la accesibilidad de la atención médica", dijo Laura Chapin, portavoz de Cobalt Abortion Fund, una organización que brinda apoyo financiero a individuos que buscan un aborto.
En los dos años transcurridos desde que se anuló Roe v. Wade, Chapin ha visto un incremento en la demanda del aborto, como también de personas que necesitan ayuda para con el acceso a este servicio. Muchas personas están recurriendo a proveedores de Colorado en busca de ayuda.
"La decisión de Dobbs ha volcado la atención médica a lo largo de la nación", dijo Chapin. "Hemos visto un efecto dominó enorme. Hemos visto como pacientes son empujados a otros estados para recibir atención, hemos visto médicos de Colorado completamente abrumados con pacientes".
Una nueva encuesta de KFF, una fuente de investigación sobre política de salud independiente, informa que, para mujeres de edad reproductiva, 1 de cada 7 ha tenido un aborto. Casi 1 de cada 10 mujeres conoce a alguien que ha tenido dificultades para abortar desde que se anuló Roe.
Además, dos tercios de todas las mujeres que participaron en la encuesta temen que las prohibiciones del aborto puedan ponerlas a ellas o a un ser querido en peligro si un aborto es necesario.
"Digo, todos hemos oído las anécdotas, hemos visto las historias", dijo Chapin. "Y creo que los hallazgos confirman lo que muchos de nosotros hemos sospechado. Y ahora, en realidad lo están cuantificando y apuntando".
Mientras que las prohibiciones entran en vigor en algunos estados y los desafíos legales dejan a la atención de salud en limbo en otros, Chapin dijo que la organización Cobalt está dando un paso adelante para ayudar a las personas a tener acceso a este servicio.
Sin embargo, a medida que sube la demanda, sus recursos se estrechan.
Cobalt anunció el miércoles que estarán implementando un límite de capacidad de financiación después de que la demanda de pacientes disparara tras de la decisión de Dobbs, incrementando sus costos. Desde el 2022, los gastos de la organización para cubrir los servicios médicos y de viaje han aumentado de $700.000 a una cifra proyectada de $2 millones este año.
"Lo que definitivamente hemos visto aquí en Colorado es un aumento de personas que no pueden tener acceso al aborto en sus propios estados viniendo acá porque saben que lo pueden hacer", dijo Chapin.
Este otoño, los votantes de Colorado decidirán si quieren proteger los derechos del aborto en la constitución del estado, así como los votantes de Arizona y Missouri.
Con miedo e incertidumbre rodeando a las mujeres del país, Chapin dijo que espera que este problema impulse a la gente a votar este noviembre.
"Anticipo que el aborto sea uno de los temas principales, si no es el tema principal, en las elecciones", dijo Chapin. "Cuando las personas se están dando cuenta de que, 'Esto me puede pasar a mí, también le puede pasar a alguien que amo, alguien que conozco', entienden que no es aceptable que alguien lo prohíba.
Close Ad

author: Bloomberg News
title: Brazil’s Unemployment Rate Falls Again in November, Signaling Labor Market Resilience
text:
(Bloomberg) -- Brazil’s unemployment rate fell for the eighth straight month, indicating the labor market is still holding up as a slowdown in Latin America’s largest economy takes hold.
Official data released Friday showed the unemployment rate declined to 7.5% in November from a month earlier, matching the median estimate from analysts surveyed by Bloomberg. The number of jobless workers stood at 8.2 million.
Brazil’s economy proved resilient to double-digit borrowing costs during much of the year, with unemployment falling to levels not seen since 2015. Analysts and policymakers point to reforms such as a labor overhaul in 2017 to explain the country’s ability to grow without stoking inflation. Central bankers led by Roberto Campos Neto are cutting now rates as prices edge toward target.
After kicking off one of the first easing cycles in the region in August, policymakers have since reduced rates by two percentage points, to 11.75%. They’ve also signaled two more half-percentage point drops through March.
Read more: Brazil Annual Inflation Tops All Estimates in Early December
--With assistance from Giovanna Serafim.
©2023 Bloomberg L.P.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: The warmest December in Franklin County history
text: The popular image of an idyllic December is one of white Christmases, hot chocolate retreats, snow-capped conifers, and cozy, cold-weather activities. But not every December lives up to those expectations. Most of the continental U.S. will experience its peak winter cold weather in January and February . Officially, winter doesn't even start until Dec. 21. Across the U.S., the average December temperature from 1901-2000 was right above freezing point, at 32.68 F. Yearly temperatures can be compared to this 20th-century long-term average to find how uncommon a year's December climate was. The nation's warmest December on record was 2021, when the average temperature reached 6.66 F above the long-term average, at 39.34 F. December 2022 was closer to the previous century's average for the U.S. overall, at 33.08 F. The average temperature in Franklin County, Pennsylvania from 1901-2000 was 31.7. The diverse climates of the U.S. mean residents can experience a range of holiday weather without breaking out their passports. Within the continental U.S., Monroe County, Florida, at the Southeast tip of the state, reported the highest average December temperature during the past century at 67.6 F. On the other end of the spectrum was Roseau County, Minnesota, bordering Canada, at 7.2 F. However, across both sides of the extremes, temperatures are warming. While that doesn't mean every December will be warmer than the last or the prior century's average, it does mean long-term temperature averages will continue to inch up the thermometer. When did Franklin County, Pennsylvania experience its warmest December? To find out, Stacker used data from the National Centers for Environmental Information to identify the 15 Decembers with the highest average temperature since 1895. Also included is how that year's temperature compared to the 1901-2000 average. Read on to see if you lived through the warmest December in Franklin County, Pennsylvania history.

author: Mikhail Gamandiy-Egorov
title: The Alliance of Sahel States or the great African victory
text: - Support Réseau International We need you by Mikhail Gamandiy-Egorov The creation in 2023 of the AES between Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger represents a major success both for the Sahel region, but also a big step forward on the African continental scale and within the framework of the multipolar world order. Despite the existing challenges, the said alliance represents hope for a very large number of Africans and supporters of multipolarity. The year that is ending is characterized by numerous events and upheavals on a global scale. More than ever, the confrontation between supporters of the contemporary international multipolar order and those who stubbornly refuse to recognize this reality has reached its highest level of intensity. Nevertheless, and despite the numerous challenges that the defenders of multipolarity will have to face in the face of attempts at destabilization that come from an obvious minority of those nostalgic for a bygone era – the determination of the former is more than ever at the top. Including on the great African continent. One of the great events of this year was undoubtedly [creation](http://www.observateurcontinental.fr/?module=articles&action=view&id=5446) of the Alliance of Sahel States (AES) by the leaderships of Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger. All with broad popular support from African nations. The new great Sahelian alliance represents not only a hard blow for all the revisionist forces united within an obvious global minority, but above all and this is the most important – a great source of enthusiasm for the citizens of the countries concerned, as well as 'on an even broader African and international scale. As spearhead of Pan-Africanism and multipolarity on the African continent. The challenges obviously remain numerous. The objectives of Western regimes aimed at destabilizing by all means at their disposal the AES projects, the still existing presence of US troops on Niger soil, the security challenges, such as the need to put an end to the countries of the alliance to the neocolonial monetary instrument of the CFA franc. But once again the contemporary reality is such that the so-called attempts at destabilization which emanate from the West today represent in a way a boost to the projects of full and complete liberation both for the Sahel region, as well as on the scale of the whole of Africa which aspires to become an important actor within the contemporary and post-Western world order. Each new advance, including military victories against elements in the pay of the Atlanticist establishment, as was the case with [the Liberation](http://www.observateurcontinental.fr/?module=articles&action=view&id=5407) recent development of the strategic Malian town of Kidal after long years of occupation by terrorist and armed groups – will not only be celebrated, but above all will represent a further step towards achieving the necessary objectives. The AES is ultimately the result of a dream long held by millions of Africans who aspire to true independence and sovereignty, within a pan-African framework and a more just world order. This dream has become reality, but today it is important not to limit ourselves to the achievements obtained and to continue the path traced by the great African names who inspire their descendants more than ever, becoming themselves great sources of additional inspiration. to the new generation of inhabitants of Africa and the world. Once again - this path will certainly be strewn with pitfalls, but knowing the enemies of the contemporary order so well - the partisan forces of the multipolar era have everything necessary to put the said enemies out of harm's way. Step by step, step by step. By striking where it hurts most and freeing themselves from the illusions of the past. The future is multipolar and post-Western. This future is already being built right now. And Africa has a lot to contribute to this common future of peoples who have largely understood how the new global architecture will be built. source: [Observatory Continental](https://www.observateurcontinental.fr/?module=articles&action=view&id=5565)

author: Newsfile
title: Ready to Launch Cybria Mainnet: An Innovative Blend of Blockchain and Artificial Intelligence | Markets | bigspringherald.com
text:
Transformative Launch Marks a New Era for Cybria Ecosystem
Istanbul, Turkey--(Newsfile Corp. - December 28, 2023) - In August 2023, Cybria embarked on a groundbreaking journey with the ambitious mission of spearheading a blockchain revolution. The destination: Cybria Mainnet - an innovative platform seamlessly fusing blockchain technology and Artificial Intelligence (AI) is set to launch on December 30, 2023. This transformative venture is poised to elevate the Ethereum ecosystem by enhancing scalability, transaction speed, and security.
Cybria Mainnet Ready to Launch on December 30, 2023
Cybria Layer 2
Cybria operates as a Layer 2 blockchain platform strategically positioned on the Ethereum network. Designed to augment scalability and bolster transaction efficiency, Cybria leverages the power of Cybersecurity and AI technologies to fortify network safety and optimize performance. The marriage of blockchain and AI opens doors to novel applications across diverse domains, underscoring the pivotal role AI plays in advancing various aspects of Cybria.
The Evolution of AI Integration
The journey commenced with the experimental Testnet v1, which evolved into the more robust v2. This evolution marked the advent of a new Layer 2 Blockchain solution, one supercharged by AI capabilities. The integration of AI into blockchain technology signifies a leap towards innovative and powerful applications, setting the stage for Cybria's imminent impact.
Launching Cybria Mainnet: December 30, 2023
After four months of anticipation, the Cybria Mainnet launch is set to launch on December 30, 2023. This milestone event will not only unveil the Mainnet but also introduce the Cybria Bridge and Cybria Swap, key components that will animate the Cyba Ecosystem. The launch heralds a new era of possibilities, where the synergy of blockchain and AI is set to redefine the digital landscape.
Cybria Bridge and Swap
The Cybria Bridge stands as a gateway for the seamless transfer of digital assets and data between Ethereum and Cybria. At the Mainnet release, the Ethereum-Cyba Chain Bridge will be available, facilitating the fluid movement of assets. Simultaneously, the Cybria Swap empowers users to transact on the Cyba Chain while enhancing liquidity, providing a comprehensive solution for those entering the Cyba ecosystem.
With the inauguration of Cybria Mainnet, enthusiasts and early adopters are invited to join the Cyba ecosystem and embark on a journey of innovation and growth. Cybria Mainnet represents not only a technical milestone but a pivotal moment in the evolution of blockchain and AI integration.
In summary, the launch of Cybria Mainnet marks a turning point in the realm of blockchain technology, signaling a future where the fusion of AI and blockchain redefines the possibilities within the digital landscape.
